Package it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model

Class MovementPhase

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.Phase
it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.MovementPhase
public class MovementPhase
extends Phase
This class represents the moment of the game in which the player makes its standard movement

    executes the move sent by the worker, according to the rules assigned by the game and/or the player's card
    BasicRules getBasicRules()

    obtains the possible moves that a worker can make
    void handle()
    method used by the phase to develop the part of the game logic assigned.
    void jumpUp()
    if the playing worker moves up, it forces the other player to not move up their workers until it's this player's turn again
    void map()
    initializes the hashMaps related to the phase
    void pushAction()
    lets a worker push one of the opponent workers surrounding it.
    void pushMoves()
    It includes in possibleMoves the opponent workers that can be pushed by the playing worker
    void restore()
    If maxHeight has been modified during SpecialPhase1, this method will set it back to the value saved in previousMaxHeight and setting previousMaxHeight back to BasicRules.BASICMAXHEIGHT
    void swapMoves()
    includes in possibleMoves the opponent workers surrounding the playing worker, it then calls the secondary function related to the player's card

      private Square position
      generic parameter used by actionMethod() to save the position where the extra move is going to be performed, or by getMoves() when examining the worker's possible moves

  • Constructor Details

    • MovementPhase

      public MovementPhase​(Game game, Context context, Player player, Builder builder1, Builder builder2)
      used to create a new MovementPhase
      Parameters:
      game - represents the game
      context - represents the context of the game
      player - represents the current player
      builder1 - represents the current player's first worker
      builder2 - represents the current player's second worker

  • Method Details

    • handle

      public void handle() throws java.io.IOException
      method used by the phase to develop the part of the game logic assigned. In the State Pattern, it represents the main method that has to be implemented. It also includes the game's losing condition.
      Specified by:
      handle in class Phase
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • map

      public void map()
      initializes the hashMaps related to the phase
      Specified by:
      map in class Phase

    • getMoves

      public java.util.ArrayList<Square> getMoves​(Builder builder)
      obtains the possible moves that a worker can make
      Parameters:
      builder - is the worker examined
      Returns:
      the arrayList of possible moves that the worker can make

    • swapMoves

      public void swapMoves()
      includes in possibleMoves the opponent workers surrounding the playing worker, it then calls the secondary function related to the player's card

    • pushMoves

      public void pushMoves()
      It includes in possibleMoves the opponent workers that can be pushed by the playing worker

    • actionMethod

      public void actionMethod​(Builder builder, Square arrival) throws java.io.IOException
      executes the move sent by the worker, according to the rules assigned by the game and/or the player's card
      Parameters:
      builder - is the worker who makes the move
      arrival - is the position where the move is going to be performed
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • jumpUp

      public void jumpUp()
      if the playing worker moves up, it forces the other player to not move up their workers until it's this player's turn again

    • pushAction

      public void pushAction()
      lets a worker push one of the opponent workers surrounding it. This move can never resolve in the opponent worker's victory

    • restore

      public void restore()
      If maxHeight has been modified during SpecialPhase1, this method will set it back to the value saved in previousMaxHeight and setting previousMaxHeight back to BasicRules.BASICMAXHEIGHT

    • getBasicRules

      public BasicRules getBasicRules()
      Returns:
      the game's basicRules
